pullRequest.body:
by declaring them all in `where` style with implicit type assumptions and `inst` prefix

Here to reduce the diff from #11203

```suggestion
  __ := instRing
```
(and throughout)
Why should I do this? It's more prone to people accidentally rearranging sources and messing up the instance.

I think that's a problem for a linter to solve, not something that we want in the source code. This spelling is more brittle than using `__` everywhere, and still doesn't stop you writing `toTheGrandparentClass :=` and still making a mess.
Also note that despite you "fixing the mess" of some of the parents orders, this seems not to have actually impacted performance.
I suspect this is more due to the relatively little use of `MulOpposite` than poor performance of my technique
Oh, I don't claim your technique is problematic performance-wise; I think it's uglier and more fragile than my suggested technique, while being exactly the same performance-wise.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: Homogenise instances for `MulOpposite`/`AddOpposite`
